availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William Rogers (Bath County, Kentucky, farmer, preacher)

body.p: Bath County, Kentucky, farmer and preacher. Virginia native. Married to Linda Ann "Linney" Bristow Rogers in Bath County, Kentucky, on May 30, 1826. Father of Joseph Rogers, James Rogers, Matilda Rogers, William H Rogers, Elizabeth A Rogers, Samuel Rogers, and Andrew J Rogers. Farmer in Bath County in 1850. Baptist preacher in Bath County in 1860. Owned thirteen enslaved persons in Bath County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bath County, Division 2, p. 28A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bath County, Owingsville, p. 29.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bath County, Sharpsburg, p. 94A.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Bath County Marriages, Film 000273003, p. 316.
